CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. 2 reads: "Family Faces Dilemma - Mr. and Mrs. Prentiss Parrish, with their eight children, ranging from ages four to 20, are wondering just how they can solve their present dilemma of finding a decent place in which to live. The dilemma is caused by sub-standard housing, housing discrimination, lack of work and an unreasonable landlady who, because of delinquent rent, wants to set the family out into the street."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Mr. and Mrs. Prentiss Parrish and their eight children, gathered on front stoop of brick row house at 31 Gilmore Way
